1610350298_1yhTF4WKRZsCBdVeh8fwPj14zAiEd.body: Artix. It's not ideal due lack of some scripts (mostly container apps), but I don't like systemd. NixOS seems interesting, but it also contains systemd (and it's extremely hard to get rid of it).

> [mxh69420](#comment_42_1HK2gCWJmrTvacZbHqEC27oVygDjUohzdx):

There is no ideal system. OSS usually lack a lot of features, or just works in strange way. Closed source sucks in terms of privacy and also works extremely dumb. Also, ususally OSS does not mean quality. Not going to defend MS or other corpo, but I know only few stable and advanced systems, and they are all closed source (mostly). QNX is a good example. As for desktop usage - they are all crappy in some way.
